title.narrative: Multi-sectoral assistance for newly accessible areas in South Jebel Marra, Kass locality of South Darfur state

description.narrative: This response in south Jebel Marra, Karrey and Dilli, in Kass locality of South Darfur State targets host communities and IDP’s in both government and SLA/AW controlled areas and will focus on providing minimal basic services in the area. During the last decade, much of the area was excluded from the provision of basic services. Only in 2020, humanitarian access was again available, allowing humanitarian actors to start up their response, with SHF funding, among others. Through this 2021 allocation, UNOCHA has requested WVS and three other Humanitarian workers to provide a multi-sectoral response, covering health, nutrition, livelihoods, protection and WASH basic services in their area of operations. World Vision is proposing an integrated lifesaving intervention project to meet the immediate needs of the vulnerable communities in south Jebel Marra, Karrey and Dilli, in Kass locality of South Darfur State. The main goal of the project is to provide humanitarian assistance to improve health, nutrition, protection, and WASH status among target IDPs, returnees, and vulnerable host communities. This will be achieved through enhancing access to basic services including health and nutrition and WASH with the integration of protection activities in all operational areas. The project will target 123,164 Vulnerable individuals of which 24140 are men, 25125 women, 36210 boys, and 37688 girls. 79% of the targeted population (96792) are vulnerable host communities, 20% are internally displaced people (24692) and 1% are returnees (1680). The key project interventions will aim at 1) Increasing access to Primary Health Care services, particularly maternal, child health, and malnutrition among U5, 2) Empowering communities to actively participate in activities that contribute to the increased household and community resilience thereby enabling them to respond to future shocks in their respective areas, 3) Increasing access to Protection activities and 4) Increasing access to WASH services to reduce water-related diseases. The project will contribute to a reduction of morbidity and mortality caused by poor access to health and nutrition services among the targeted groups, inadequate access to basic water, hygiene and sanitation services as well as building the resilience of target communities through improved access to protection activities. The targeted localities are ranked under HNO severity scoring of 4 and 5 in South Darfur state and will be supported through the provision of integrated life-saving Health and Nutrition services to households with highly malnourished populations, as well as WASH and Protection intervention.
